intro: Dimeria manongarivensis, commonly known as the Manongarivensis dimeria, is a rare and endemic species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick,肉质 leaves. It produces a distinctive type of fruit known as a schizocarp, which splits into two parts when mature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Dimeria manongarivensis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
